            // Reset the meter if the data store is too old.
__tnt.metering.init.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("checking reset date");

    var expireDate = new Date(__tnt.metering.config.date);
    var lastDate = new Date(__tnt.recent.date.get());
    
    expireDate = expireDate.getTime();
    lastDate = lastDate.getTime();
    
    if(Number(lastDate)<Number(expireDate)){
        __tnt.log("resetting restrictions");
        var nextDate = new Date(expireDate+(__tnt.metering.config.days * 86400000));

        __tnt.recent.count.set(0);
        __tnt.recent.date.set(nextDate.getTime());

        __tnt.log(nextDate);
    }
});

// Set the 'read' variable if the current asset is in the recent assets list
__tnt.metering.init.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("checking whether user has read this before");
    
    var recent = __tnt.recent.assets.get();
    var uuid = __tnt.metering.config.uuid;
    
    var check = false;
    var i = 0;
    while(!check && i < recent.length){
        if(recent[i]==uuid){
            __tnt.log("found asset in recent");
            var check = true;
        }
        i++;
    }    
    
    if(check){
        __tnt.log("user has read this already");
        __tnt.metering.config.read = true;
    }else{
        __tnt.log("not read before");
    }
});

});

        return true;

});

// Allows a user arriving from a listed site to bypass any restrictions and access the site
__tnt.metering.access.c.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("Checking referrer to see if the user arrived from a permitted site.");
            
    var sites = ['lm.facebook.com','l.facebook.com','m.facebook.com','news.google.com','news.yahoo.com','facebook.com','twitter.com','t.co','fb.me','plus.google.com','goo.gl','google.com','yahoo.com','drudgereport.com','paid.outbrain.com','rma-api.gravity.com','fark.com','bing.com','tpc.googlesyndication.com','msn.com','reddit.com','hsrd.yahoo.com','aol.com','idrudgereport.com','search.tb.ask.com','aol.com'];
    
    var cleanedReferrer = String(String(window.document.referrer).split('?')[0]).replace(/https\:\/\/|http\:\/\//,'').replace(/www/,'');
    var check = false;
    
    $.each(sites,function(){
        var regexp = String(this).replace(/\./g,'\\.').replace(/\,/g,'|');
    
        if(String(cleanedReferrer).search(regexp)>-1){
            __tnt.log("User arrived from site, entry granted");
        
            check = true;
        }else{
        	__tnt.log("User arrived from other site, no special access");
        }
    });
    
    __tnt.metering.config.referred = check;
    return check;
});
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("executing granted scripts");

    if(window.ga){
        if(__tnt.metering.config.read){

            __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'tnt-metering','action':'free view','label':'previously read','value':Number(__tnt.recent.count.get())});
        }else{
            // log new view
            if(__tnt.user.loggedIn){

            }

        }
    }
});
// increment counter on new assets
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){

__tnt.metering.access.d.push(function(){

});

__tnt.metering.compatibility = function(){
    var compatible = true;
    var status = "";
    
    /* this checks for compatibility with DOM storage */
    try{
        window.sessionStorage.setItem('__tnt.compatibility',true);
    }catch(e){

        status = "FAIL: setItem unsupported";
    };
    if(!compatible){
        __tnt.log(status);
    }
    return {'check':compatible,'status':status};
};
var bloxHasSubscription = false;
            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            /* if service not whitelisted check user service */
            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4615);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5319);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4522);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4523);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4524);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5255);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://herald-review.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });


    </script>

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>MOUNT ZION -- The village of Mount Zion has issued a mandatory boil order effective 8 p.m. Sunday until further notice.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/herald-review.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>The village was notified by the Illinois Environmental Protection Agency that testing has shown the presence of organisms that could cause illness, Village Administrator Julie Miller said. Mount Zion water customers should boil for five minutes all water used for drinking and cooking until they have been notified that the water is safe to drink.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/herald-review.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/herald-review.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>The water will be safe for bathing, laundry and general cleaning, the village said. Dishwashers should not be used, and water should be boiled before washing dishes.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Residents can check the village website, <a href="http://www.mtzion.com">www.mtzion.com</a>, for up-to-date information on the boil order status.</p></div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

</div></div></div><script>
        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#tncms-region-asset_side_sticky');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://herald-review.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=011bc2cb-4aa0-5865-95af-d3de9c4e9c31&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://herald-review.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=011bc2cb-4aa0-5865-95af-d3de9c4e9c31&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != '011bc2cb-4aa0-5865-95af-d3de9c4e9c31') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://herald-review.com/tncms/block/1393384/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

Health department issues boil order for Coulterville

Sunday, Sept. 14, 2014 - 9:50 a.m. - Around 7 p.m. last night, residents living in the Coulterville Water District reported to the Mariposa County Sheriff's Office that they had no water. As a public safety precaution, the Mariposa County Health Department has issued a boil order for all residents in that water district, effective immediately.

According to Sheriff Doug Binnewies, public works employees responded to the Coulterville community and were able to currect the problem.

Due to the water flow stoppage, the  health department has requested a water Boil Order notice distributed to the clients of the Coulterville Water District until further notice.

Potable water is to be boiled for at least one minute to ensure that it is safe to consume.  

This is a safety measure until further testing can be done.

Look for further details as they develop.

Willow Knolls boil order lifted

Saturday
Sep 13, 2014 at 5:00 PM

PEORIA — A boil order has been lifted for residents affected by a water main break on Willow Knolls Drive earlier this week.

Fewer than 200 customers were affected by the boil order, an Illinois American Water spokesman said.

The water company said in a news release Friday that crews will install two valves to replace the damaged main to improve infrastructure and prevent future water main breaks.

During construction and road repairs, only the eastbound lane on Willow Knolls Drive between Radnor Road and War Memorial Drive will be open.

Motorists are encouraged to obey any detours and avoid the area if possible. Eastbound lanes will remain open as road repairs are completed.

Boydell Water Again Under Boil Order

Pressure Supposed to Be Restored Tuesday

  • By David Moyers
  • Sep 16, 2014
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email

Obituaries

Obituaries - Nov. 29, 2017

  • Nov 28, 2017

Full Text Read more

Obituaries - Nov. 22, 2017

  • Nov 21, 2017

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email
  • Print
  • Save

The Arkansas Department of Health listed the Boydell Water Association as having a boil order effective on Wednesday morning of this past week, and the order remained in effect on Monday. The system has approximately 55 customers.

The health department noted that the entire system had a problem with the well not maintaining pressure which led to the boil order. Montrose Mayor Vernon Coulter confirmed on Monday that the problem arose on Wednesday, Sept. 10, when the motor in the Boydell well that supplies water to the system burned up. He said after workers  replaced the motor in the well, they discovered that the entire well, not the motor had malfunctioned.

The mayor said Lane Arkansas installed a submersible pump to provide water to Boydell and Jerome later that afternoon. While both areas have water, Coulter said, it is at low pressure. He noted that Lane Arkansas anticipated making repairs and expects to have the water service at full power on Tuesday, Sept. 16.

<script type="text/javascript">
  (function ($, list){
    var ajaxUrl = $(".site-nav-list").eq(0).attr('ajaxurl');
	var domain = window.location.host;
    var overSupernav = false;
    var mousehover;
    var theTimer;
    var itemArray = list.substring(1).split(",");
    var haveMenu = {};
    var z = itemArray.length - 1;
    for(; z > -1; z--) {
        haveMenu[itemArray[z]] = [false,false];/*first parameter is used to judge if the nav item have load the ajax html dom node, the second parameter is used to judge if the nav item  have sent the ajax url request*/
    };
    
    $(".supernav").mouseleave(function(){ 
        allInvis(); 
    }).mouseenter(function(){ 
        overSupernav = true; 
    });

    function bindSuperNavEvent(filterSubClassString) {
        $(filterSubClassString).mouseenter(function(){ 
            overSupernav = true; 
        });
    
        $(filterSubClassString).mouseleave(function(){ 
            allInvis(); 
        });
    };
    
    function checkForIt(){
        clearInterval(theTimer);
        theTimer = setInterval(function(){ 
        clearInterval(theTimer);
        if(overSupernav == false){ 
        allInvis(); 
        } 
        }, 1000);
        
    };
    
    var allInvis = function(){
        overSupernav = false;
        clearInterval(theTimer);
        var theSupernav = $(".supernav");
        theSupernav.addClass("supernav-vis");
        for(var t = 0; t < itemArray.length; t++){
            var finderClassString = ".site-nav-"+itemArray[t]+"-link";
             if (itemArray[t] == "local") {
                $(finderClassString).removeClass("teg-gen");
            } else {
                $(finderClassString).removeClass("teg-" + itemArray[t])
            }
        }
    };
    
    var handleHoverEvent = function(i,flag) {
        (function(index){
            var finderClassString = ".site-nav-"+itemArray[index]+"-link";
            var finderSubClassString = "."+itemArray[index]+"-supernav";
            $(finderClassString).mouseover(function(){
                mousehover = this;
                var self = this;
                var preAjaxUrl = ajaxUrl;
                var friendlyURL = $(this).attr('friendlyURL');
                 var url = "http://"+ domain + preAjaxUrl.replace("frendlyUrl_place_holder", friendlyURL).replace("module_instance_id_place_holder","MOD-NAVIGAION-HEADLINE-LIST");
                if(friendlyURL != null && haveMenu[itemArray[index]][0] == false && haveMenu[itemArray[index]][1] == false) {
                    haveMenu[itemArray[index]][1] = true;
                    $.ajax({
                            type: "GET",
                            url: url,
                            current:self,
                            success:function(html){
                                $("header.site-header").eq(0).after(html.trim());
                                haveMenu[itemArray[index]][0] = true;
                                bindSuperNavEvent(finderSubClassString);
                                if(flag) {
                                    $(finderClassString).addClass("teg-gen"); 
                                } else {
                                    $(finderClassString).addClass("teg-"+itemArray[index]);
                                }
                                if(self == mousehover) {
                                    allInvis();
                                    $(finderSubClassString).removeClass("supernav-vis");
                                }
                            },
                            error:function(){
                                haveMenu[itemArray[index]][1] = false;
                            }
                        });
                } else if(haveMenu[itemArray[index]][0]) {
                    allInvis(); 
                    if(flag) {
                        $(finderClassString).addClass("teg-gen"); 
                    } else {
                        $(finderClassString).addClass("teg-"+itemArray[index]);
                    }
                    $(finderSubClassString).removeClass("supernav-vis");
                };
            });
                
            $(finderClassString).mouseout(function(){
                mousehover = null;
                checkForIt();
            });
        })(i);
    };
    
    (function(){
      for(var i = 0; i< itemArray.length; i++){
        if (itemArray[i] == "local") {
            handleHoverEvent(i,true);
        } else {
            handleHoverEvent(i,false);
        }
      }
    })();
	

    /* Bind touch events so menu is usable on tablets */
    var siteNavLinkString = '.site-nav-link.site-nav-text-link',
        siteNavString = '.site-nav,.supernav',
        pageBody = $('body'),
        pageNav = $('nav.site-nav');

    function onNavClick(event) {
        event.preventDefault();
    }

    function onNavTouchEnd(event) {
        pageNav.data('nav-open', event.target);
        pageBody.on('touchend', onBodyTouchEnd);
    }

    function onNavTouchStart(event) {
        /* Simulate click behavior if this nav has been tapped once before */
        if (pageNav.data('nav-open') == event.target) {
            window.location.href = event.currentTarget.href;
        }
        /* Disable click event */
        if (pageNav.data('click-bound') != true) {
            pageNav.on('click', siteNavLinkString, onNavClick)
            pageNav.data('click-bound', true);
        }
        pageNav.data('nav-open', null);
    }

    function onBodyTouchEnd(event) {
        var $target = $(event.target);
        if ($target.not(siteNavString) && $target.parents(siteNavString).length === 0) {
            pageBody.off('touchend', onBodyTouchEnd);
            pageNav.data('nav-open', null);
            allInvis();
        }
    }
    pageNav.on('touchstart', siteNavLinkString, onNavTouchStart)
        .on('touchend', siteNavLinkString, onNavTouchEnd);
    /* end touch events section */
            
    
  })(jQuery, ',weather,local,traffic,sports,features,about');

</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
            (function($, A){
                var containerId = '_56_INSTANCE_VFYcN0dFE8KE_MOD-AD-LEADERBOARD_ATF_DESKTOP',
                    container = $('#'+containerId),
                    adUnitName = '/32805352/me-portland-WCSH-B3332/news/local',
                    GIADCEnable = 'false';
                var isLazyLoadByABTest = '';
                if(GIADCEnable == "true"){
                    var getQueryString = function(name){
                        var reg = new RegExp("(^|&)"+ name +"=([^&]*)(&|$)");
                        var r = window.location.search.substr(1).match(reg);
                        if(r!=null)return  unescape(r[2]); return null;
                    };
                    var paramAdNetId = getQueryString("usatai");
                    var paramAdUnit = getQueryString("usatan");
                    var paramAdLabel = getQueryString("usatl");

                    var previewAdPath = 'news/local';
                    if(paramAdNetId && paramAdUnit){
                        adUnitName = "/" + paramAdNetId + "/" + paramAdUnit;
                        if(previewAdPath != ""){
                            adUnitName = adUnitName + "/" + previewAdPath;
                        }
                    }
                }
                var renderAd = function( lazyLoad ){
                    googletag.cmd.push(function() {
                        var adSlot = null;
                                                                                                                                                    var isValidSize = function( size ){
                                        return (size !== '[]' && size !== '[0,0]');
                                    };
                                    if( isValidSize('[728,90]') ){
                                        adSlot = googletag.defineSlot(adUnitName, eval('[728,90]'), containerId);
                                    }
                                                                                                            if (adSlot) {
                            adSlot.addService(googletag.pubads()).setTargeting('pos', 'leaderboard_atf');
                            if(paramAdLabel){
                                adSlot.setTargeting('adlabel', paramAdLabel);
                            }

                            if( !lazyLoad ){
                                
                                if (!isLazyLoadByABTest) {
                                    tegna.ads.initialPageAds.push(adSlot);
                                } else {
                                    
                                    var triigerEvent = function(e) {
                                        e.stopPropagation();
                                        e.stopImmediatePropagation();
                                        
                                        container.data(tegna.ads.LAZY_PENDING_DATA_KEY, false);
                                        container.trigger(tegna.ads.LAZY_SLOT_DEFINED_EVENT);
                                    };
                                    container.data(tegna.ads.LAZY_LOAD_TRIGGER_EVENT,triigerEvent);
                                    container.one(tegna.ads.LAZY_LOAD_TRIGGER_EVENT, triigerEvent);
                                    adSlot.addService(googletag.content());
                                    container.data(tegna.ads.LAZY_PENDING_DATA_KEY, true);
                                    container.data(tegna.ads.SLOT_DATA_KEY, adSlot);

                                    tegna.ads.abTestModAds.push(container);
                                }

                            } else {
                                /* Allows us to clear the contents when needed. */
                                adSlot.addService(googletag.content());
                                
                                container.data(tegna.ads.SLOT_DATA_KEY, adSlot);
                            }
                        } else {
                            tegna.utils.log( '*** Ad Slot not created for ' + containerId + ' ***' );
                        }
                        if( lazyLoad ){
                            container.trigger(tegna.ads.LAZY_SLOT_DEFINED_EVENT);
                        }
                    });
                };
                if (false || tegna.ads.lazyLoad) {
                    /* Reset to false for other ads on the page */
                    tegna.ads.lazyLoad = false;
            
                    var onTiggered = function(e) {
                        e.stopPropagation();
                        e.stopImmediatePropagation();
            
                        container.data(tegna.ads.LAZY_PENDING_DATA_KEY, false);
                        renderAd(true);
                    };
                    container.data(tegna.ads.LAZY_PENDING_DATA_KEY, true).one(tegna.ads.LAZY_LOAD_TRIGGER_EVENT, onTiggered);
                } else {
                   
                    renderAd();
                }
            })( jQuery, AUI() );

<p></p><p><b>JAY, Maine </b>(NEWS CENTER) -- Jay Village Water District issued a boil order Friday after a waterline broke on Smith Avenue. </p><p>Crews are working to fix the waterline on Smith Avenue. Officials said only customers who have lost water need to boil it once it turns back on. Once the water is back on, samples will be tested for E.coli and coliform bacteria. After testing the water district will determine when customers can stop boiling their water.</p><p>Customers should boil all water they plan to drink, including ice cubes and water to brush teeth, for at least one minute. </p><p>Officials said the waterlines are aging in the area, but they are slated to be replaced this fall. </p>

            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });


    </script>

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>BEDFORD — Because of repairs to a water main, a boil order remains in effect for a few specific properties in Bedford.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>As reported by Bedford Utilities, the area includes:</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>• 3330 Washington Ave.</p></div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>• 1943 and 2003 34th St.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>• 3502, 3504 and 3506 T St.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>• 3514 and 3620 Able Ave.</p></div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-596517"></div></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The order was issued Wednesday. Bedford Utilities reports customers may experience no water or low pressure while the repairs are being made.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Before consuming water, residents are advised to bring it to a boil and let it boil vigorously for two minutes, then let it cool before using. Alternatively, bottled water could be used.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>For more information, contact Bedford Utilities at 275-1626 or after business hours at 275-7173.</p></div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

                        // Click actions

                                    // Remove previous vote in form

                                    $(".reaction-count").each(function() {

                                    });
                    
                                    // Remove storage items
                                    localStorage.removeItem('selectedolditem-0d2442b4-0741-58db-8c83-4a829bf23936');
                                    localStorage.removeItem('selectedolditemClass-0d2442b4-0741-58db-8c83-4a829bf23936');
                                    localStorage.removeItem('increaseCounter-0d2442b4-0741-58db-8c83-4a829bf23936');
                                    localStorage.removeItem('key');
                    
                                    // Add the new vote

                                    $('.form-icons.' + emotion[i]).css('background-color', 'rgba(0,0,0,.1)');
                                    $('form#reaction-form').submit();

                                    var classStorage = emotion[i];
                                    localStorage.setItem("selectedolditem-0d2442b4-0741-58db-8c83-4a829bf23936", id);
                                    localStorage.setItem("selectedolditemClass-0d2442b4-0741-58db-8c83-4a829bf23936", classStorage);
                    
                                    // Add a count to the vote

                                    var counterK = parseInt($.trim($("span." + emotion[i] + "-over-k").html()));
                                    var counterKlabel = $("span." + emotion[i] + "-over-k");

                                    var counterIncrease = $("#reaction-" + emotion[i] + "-count").html(++counter);
                                    var mainNumberK = $("." + emotion[i] + " #over-k-count");
                                    var counterK = parseInt($.trim($("span." + emotion[i] + "-over-k").html()));
                                    var labelCounterIncrease = $(emotion[i] + "-icon.add-count").html(++counter);

	function replaceCardLead() {
		var allLeads = document.getElementsByClassName("card-lead");
		for (var i = 0; i < allLeads.length; i++) {
			var oldLead = document.getElementsByClassName("card-lead")[i];
			var newLead = oldLead.innerHTML.replace(/(<p[^>]+?>|<p>|<\/p>)/img, " ");
			document.getElementsByClassName("card-lead")[i].innerHTML = newLead;
		}
	}


	document.onkeyup = KeyCheck;
	function KeyCheck(e) {
		var KeyID = (window.event) ? event.keyCode : e.keyCode;
		switch(KeyID) {
		case 27:
			// Escape key
			if (document.getElementById('postit')) {
				document.getElementById('postit').style.visibility = 'hidden';
				document.getElementById('postit').style.display = 'none';
			}

				document.getElementById('wrapperAdPW').style.display = 'none';
				document.body.style.marginTop = '0px';
			}
			break;
		}
	}

	function wlGetCookie(cname) {
		var name = cname + "=";
		var ca = document.cookie.split(';');
		for (var i = 0; i < ca.length; i++) {
			var c = ca[i];
			while (c.charAt(0) == ' ')

		}
		return "";

		d.setTime(d.getTime() + (exdays * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000));

Water main breaks on Willow Knolls

Wednesday
Sep 10, 2014 at 6:21 PM Sep 10, 2014 at 10:56 PM

Crews began repairs on Wednesday

Zach Berg Journal Star news reporter

PEORIA — A water main break Wednesday afternoon closed Willow Knolls Drive to traffic between West War Memorial Drive and North Radnor Road.

The break was first spotted in front of Subway and Coneys on Willow at 4:45 p.m. At about 6 p.m., water was seeping out from the middle of the road and pooling in the shared parking lot of Subway, Coneys and Double A’s Pizza Pub. Crews began tearing up the road to fix the pipe later that night.

“We’re going to try to get a lane of traffic open as soon as possible, but it’s safety first. Our crews have to make sure everything is fixed and safe for drivers before we open it up again,” said Illinois American spokeswoman Karen Cotton.

As of 9:45 p.m., westbound Willow Knolls was inaccessible at its intersection with Radnor, but was accessible from the Willow Knolls Shopping Center exit. The eastbound lane was completely open. Officials said there could be periodic closures of both lanes after rush hour traffic Thursday morning.

Illinois American said in a news release that to fix the broken 16-inch diameter pipe, water service to the area will be “temporarily interrupted” to some customers in the area.

Once water service is returned, a boil water order will be in effect.

Cotton said the company was contacting all of those who would be without water about the situation. No exact number of customers affected was available Wednesday evening.

A water main break occurred Sept. 3 on Willow Knolls just north of its intersection with War Memorial. Cotton said it was hard to tell if there was any relationship between the two breaks.

“It’s really hard to predict the cause of these breaks, unless there’s an obvious cause like the extreme cold we had last winter,” Cotton said.

Cotton said there has not been an increase in breaks in the Peoria area this year, just more breaks in “more visible areas, more high traffic areas, so it seems like there have been more this year.”

Please look at the time stamp on the story to see when it was last updated.</div> <article class="post-93762 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-news tag-windham" id="post-93762">
<div class="entry-content">
<div class="alignright wp-post-thumbnail">
<a data-keyboard="true" data-toggle="modal" href="#thumbnail-modal">
<img alt="" class=" wp-post-image" height="225" sizes="(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px" src="https://tribwtic.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/windham-center-school.png?w=400&h=225&crop=1" srcset="https://tribwtic.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/windham-center-school.png?w=400&h=225&crop=1 400w, https://tribwtic.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/windham-center-school.png?w=150&h=84&crop=1 150w, https://tribwtic.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/windham-center-school.png?w=300&h=169&crop=1 300w" width="400"/> </a>
</div>
<div class="modal hide fade" id="thumbnail-modal" tabindex="-1">
<div class="modal-header">
<button aria-hidden="true" class="close" data-dismiss="modal" type="button">×</button>
<h4 class="title">Bacteria Found In Water At Windham Center School Again</h4>
</div>
<div class="modal-body">
<img alt="" class="attachment-gallery-cover size-gallery-cover wp-post-image" height="258" sizes="(max-width: 437px) 100vw, 437px" src="https://tribwtic.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/windham-center-school.png?w=437" srcset="https://tribwtic.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/windham-center-school.png 437w, https://tribwtic.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/windham-center-school.png?w=150 150w, https://tribwtic.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/windham-center-school.png?w=300 300w" width="437"/> <div class="lightbox-caption"></div>
</div>
</div>
<p>Windham Center School’s water supply tested positive again for bacteria.</p>
<p>The school previously closed from Wednesday, Aug. 27 to Tuesday, Sept. 2 after the water supply tested positive for bacteria.</p>
<p>The most recent test showed signs of coliform again.</p>
<p>The school will remain open while officials sanitize the well. Water fountains and sinks were shut off, and bottled water and hand washing stations have been established. School officials say there is no risk to the children.</p>
<p>The school is looking for a long-term solution to the issue.</p>
<p>Related story:</p>
<p><a href="http://go.foxct.com/1qeoDpi" target="_blank">Windham School Closed Until Sept. 2 Due To Bacteria In Water</a></p>
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
var highlander_expando_javascript = function(){
	var input = document.createElement( 'input' ),
	    comment = jQuery( '#comment' );

	if ( 'placeholder' in input ) {
		comment.attr( 'placeholder', jQuery( '.comment-textarea label' ).remove().text() );
	}

	// Expando Mode: start small, then auto-resize on first click + text length
	jQuery( '#comment-form-identity' ).hide();
	jQuery( '#comment-form-subscribe' ).hide();
	jQuery( '#commentform .form-submit' ).hide();

	comment.css( { 'height':'10px' } ).one( 'focus', function() {
		var timer = setInterval( HighlanderComments.resizeCallback, 10 )
		jQuery( this ).animate( { 'height': HighlanderComments.initialHeight } ).delay( 100 ).queue( function(n) { clearInterval( timer ); HighlanderComments.resizeCallback(); n(); } );
		jQuery( '#comment-form-identity' ).slideDown();
		jQuery( '#comment-form-subscribe' ).slideDown();
		jQuery( '#commentform .form-submit' ).slideDown();
	});
}
jQuery(document).ready( highlander_expando_javascript );
</script>

                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5611);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4534);

                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://magicvalley.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){

                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');

                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();

                });

            /* no access */

                __tnt.metering.check();

            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));

                });

            }

            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>TWIN FALLS • The boil order for southern Twin Falls has been lifted after crews worked through the night to repair a major water line break and water tests came back clean, city officials said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>The order for residents to boil water before using it for drinking, cooking or washing dishes was removed shortly before 9 a.m. Tuesday.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>As of 2 p.m. Tuesday, nine homes and two businesses still don’t have water service.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/magicvalley.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The city provided hotel accommodations to the affected residents Monday night, city spokesman Josh Palmer said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>City crews are still working at the intersection of Washington Street South and Orchard Drive, which remains closed.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“We are still expecting it to be a couple of days before the intersection is fully opened,” Palmer said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>There’s still access to nearby businesses, such as the Oasis Stop ‘N Go, Swensen’s Markets and Family Dollar Store. Signs will direct motorists about how to get to these businesses.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>City officials issued a boil order for homes and businesses south of Park Avenue to Orchard Drive, and west of Harrison Street South to Washington Street South.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>A 24-inch pipe ruptured around 8 a.m. Monday near Washington Street South and Orchard Drive.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The intersection will remain closed for the rest of the week, Palmer said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Residents throughout Twin Falls are asked to conserve water and turn off sprinkler systems until the line is repaired.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>It’s not a critical situation, but city officials want to get ahead of demand, Palmer said. “We’re not able to keep up the supply as much as we should.”</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>There was no indication water was contaminated, but the boil water order was mandated by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency in case water began siphoning back into the system due to decreased pressure.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Tests confirmed the water was safe early Tuesday so the boil order was lifted, Palmer said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>On Tuesday, nine homes and two businesses still did not have any water service.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Residents in the immediate area were provided hotel rooms Monday night to ensure they had access to safe water and were removed from the noise of crews making repairs through the night.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The city temporarily shut down the Castlewood Pressurized Irrigation Station, the largest station that utilizes potable water. It serves residential neighborhoods at Rock Creek Estates and in the area of Caswell Avenue West and Grandview Drive North.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p><strong>Broken Water Pipe, Delays</strong></p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The broken water pipe, which is only two years old, is part of a system that supplies one of the city’s main water mixing stations.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/magicvalley.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>On Monday, Washington Street South was closed in both directions between Orchard and Clinton drives.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Police and city crews directed traffic, and some school bus routes were delayed by up to 30 minutes.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Students at Canyon Ridge High, Robert Stuart Middle School and Oregon Trail Elementary arrived about 10 minutes late to class, Twin Falls School District spokeswoman Eva Craner said. No schools were affected by the boil order.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>City crews were using equipment Monday to remove a section of asphalt and expose the water line to determine the cause of the break.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Orchard Drive was just renovated this summer and reopened about two weeks ago.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/magicvalley.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1415766">
<section class="block emphasis-h3 " id="block-1415766">

</div></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Orange cones lined both sides of the street where the road is buckling along the edges.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p><strong>Businesses Impacted</strong></p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The Oasis Stop ’N Go at the corner of Washington Street South and Orchard Drive was closed as crews worked to repair the water line.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“It’s gonna hurt,” store manager Jessica Lewis said Monday morning as she stood outside watching.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Typically, the gas station sees 150 to 200 customers during the morning hours, Lewis said. “If this is going to go on all day, you’re looking at 500 to 600 (customers).”</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Crews removed mud and gravel from the Oasis parking lot using shovels and heavy equipment.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>At Ready Reserve Foods, the broken water line didn’t make much of a difference, said chief financial officer Kelley Blanton.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“We’re willing to roll with the punches,” Blanton said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The company, which sells emergency supplies, already filters city water through a purification system, Blanton said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“The biggest concern, in my opinion right now, is that our street is blocked off,” he said, which affects customers.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Airport Road Freewill Baptist Church, which was affected by the road closure, didn’t have any activities planned Monday morning, Pastor Jim O’Donnell said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>And he doesn’t think the building sustained any damage.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“It happens and you just kind of go with it. We appreciate the city crews for being so on top of it.”</p></div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

                                var marker = new google.maps.Marker({

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#tncms-region-asset_side_sticky');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://magicvalley.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=ef51e264-4268-11e4-bd64-ef43a5a93592&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://magicvalley.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=ef51e264-4268-11e4-bd64-ef43a5a93592&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != 'ef51e264-4268-11e4-bd64-ef43a5a93592') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://magicvalley.com/tncms/block/1415851/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

<noscript><div>Please enable Javascript to watch this video</div></noscript> </div> </div> </div>
<p>Some residents say they're frustrated because they spent nearly three months under a boil order with no end in sight.</p>
<p>The Village of Wataga, Illinois has been under a boil order for nearly three months.</p>
<p>The problem originated in July 2014 when the pump that pulls water from the well broke down, according to Wataga's Village President Eli Calkins. The village replaced the faulty pump with a new one, but the water supply had not yet passed the strict water-quality standards enforced by the Illinois EPA.</p>
<p><fb:post data-width="552" href="https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=825805597439095&id=175464845806510"></fb:post></p>
<p>"Right now, the EPA wants us to pump as much water to waste as we can. Then we just keep testing and keep trying," said Calkins.</p>
<p>The village had spent nearly $10,000 in efforts to repair the problem as of September 22, Calkins said.</p>
<p>The village's water supply must undergo two tests. Once the water passes both tests, the boil order can be lifted, but the water had yet to pass either test.</p>
<p>Recently, the village hired an independent company to test the water, Calkins said. In addition, the well has been "shocked" with chlorine twice in two months, in an attempt to eliminate excessive bacteria.</p>
<p>For businesses in Wataga like Casey's General Store, the ongoing boil order has taken a toll on the customers and the employees.</p>
<p>"Every day, a manager has to drive to our store in Galesburg to get water," said Jessica Benson, manager of the Wataga Casey's General Store.</p>
<p>Customers also cannot purchase popular fountain drinks or cappuccinos, Benson said.</p>
<p>Village officials did not expect water rates to rise in connection with the water supply expenditures.</p>
<p><fb:post data-width="552" href="https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=854852291201092&id=175464845806510"></fb:post></p>
</div>

Canton water main break prompts boil order on 200 block of West Oak

Monday
Sep 22, 2014 at 3:58 PM

The City of Canton Public Works Department is working to fix a water main break on the 200 block of West Oak. According to the public works administrative assistant, Nancy Mackey, once the water service is restored a boil order will be in place for resident of the area, "including West Hickory from the bridge to the wastewater treatment facility."

__tnt.metering.compatibility = function(){
    var compatible = true;
    var status = "";
    
    /* this checks for compatibility with DOM storage */

var bloxHasSubscription = false;
            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            /* if service not whitelisted check user service */
            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5611);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4534);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4535);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4540);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5331);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://magicvalley.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>TWIN FALLS • The boil order for southern Twin Falls has been lifted after crews worked through the night to repair a major water line break and water tests came back clean, city officials said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>The order for residents to boil water before using it for drinking, cooking or washing dishes was removed shortly before 9 a.m. Tuesday.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>As of 2 p.m. Tuesday, nine homes and two businesses still don’t have water service.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/magicvalley.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The city provided hotel accommodations to the affected residents Monday night, city spokesman Josh Palmer said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>City crews are still working at the intersection of Washington Street South and Orchard Drive, which remains closed.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“We are still expecting it to be a couple of days before the intersection is fully opened,” Palmer said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>There’s still access to nearby businesses, such as the Oasis Stop ‘N Go, Swensen’s Markets and Family Dollar Store. Signs will direct motorists about how to get to these businesses.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>City officials issued a boil order for homes and businesses south of Park Avenue to Orchard Drive, and west of Harrison Street South to Washington Street South.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>A 24-inch pipe ruptured around 8 a.m. Monday near Washington Street South and Orchard Drive.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The intersection will remain closed for the rest of the week, Palmer said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Residents throughout Twin Falls are asked to conserve water and turn off sprinkler systems until the line is repaired.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>It’s not a critical situation, but city officials want to get ahead of demand, Palmer said. “We’re not able to keep up the supply as much as we should.”</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>There was no indication water was contaminated, but the boil water order was mandated by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency in case water began siphoning back into the system due to decreased pressure.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Tests confirmed the water was safe early Tuesday so the boil order was lifted, Palmer said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>On Tuesday, nine homes and two businesses still did not have any water service.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Residents in the immediate area were provided hotel rooms Monday night to ensure they had access to safe water and were removed from the noise of crews making repairs through the night.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The city temporarily shut down the Castlewood Pressurized Irrigation Station, the largest station that utilizes potable water. It serves residential neighborhoods at Rock Creek Estates and in the area of Caswell Avenue West and Grandview Drive North.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p><strong>Broken Water Pipe, Delays</strong></p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The broken water pipe, which is only two years old, is part of a system that supplies one of the city’s main water mixing stations.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/magicvalley.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>On Monday, Washington Street South was closed in both directions between Orchard and Clinton drives.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Police and city crews directed traffic, and some school bus routes were delayed by up to 30 minutes.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Students at Canyon Ridge High, Robert Stuart Middle School and Oregon Trail Elementary arrived about 10 minutes late to class, Twin Falls School District spokeswoman Eva Craner said. No schools were affected by the boil order.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>City crews were using equipment Monday to remove a section of asphalt and expose the water line to determine the cause of the break.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Orchard Drive was just renovated this summer and reopened about two weeks ago.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/magicvalley.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1415766">

</div></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Orange cones lined both sides of the street where the road is buckling along the edges.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p><strong>Businesses Impacted</strong></p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The Oasis Stop ’N Go at the corner of Washington Street South and Orchard Drive was closed as crews worked to repair the water line.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“It’s gonna hurt,” store manager Jessica Lewis said Monday morning as she stood outside watching.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Typically, the gas station sees 150 to 200 customers during the morning hours, Lewis said. “If this is going to go on all day, you’re looking at 500 to 600 (customers).”</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Crews removed mud and gravel from the Oasis parking lot using shovels and heavy equipment.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>At Ready Reserve Foods, the broken water line didn’t make much of a difference, said chief financial officer Kelley Blanton.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“We’re willing to roll with the punches,” Blanton said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The company, which sells emergency supplies, already filters city water through a purification system, Blanton said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“The biggest concern, in my opinion right now, is that our street is blocked off,” he said, which affects customers.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Airport Road Freewill Baptist Church, which was affected by the road closure, didn’t have any activities planned Monday morning, Pastor Jim O’Donnell said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>And he doesn’t think the building sustained any damage.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“It happens and you just kind of go with it. We appreciate the city crews for being so on top of it.”</p></div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

                    (function() {
                        function initialize() {
                            var isDraggable = $(document).width() > 480;
                            var map = new google.maps.Map(document.getElementById('gmap-ef51e264-4268-11e4-bd64-ef43a5a93592'), {
