                            var latlngbounds = new google.maps.LatLngBounds();

                            
                                    setTimeout(function(){
                                        latlng = new google.maps.LatLng(42.534466, -114.479561)
                                        latlngbounds.extend(latlng);
                                        map.fitBounds(latlngbounds);
                                        adjustZoom(map);
                                        addMarker(latlng, map, '', 'https://mt.googleapis.com/vt/icon/name=icons/spotlight/spotlight-poi.png&scale=1', 1, '');
                                    }, 0000);}

                        function addMarker(location, map, html, icon, label, featured) {
                            if(featured == 'enhanced'){
                                /* Special display for enhanced businesses */
                                var marker = new google.maps.Marker({
                                    position: location,
                                    label: label.toString(),
                                    icon: {url: icon, labelOrigin: new google.maps.Point(11, 14)},
                                    map: map
                                });
                            }else{
                                var marker = new google.maps.Marker({
                                    position: location,
                                    icon: icon,
                                    map: map
                                });
                            }

                            if(html){
                                var infowindow = new google.maps.InfoWindow();
                                google.maps.event.addListener(marker, 'click', function () {
                                    infowindow.setContent(html);
                                    infowindow.open(map, marker);
                                });
                            }
                        }

                        function adjustZoom(map) {
                            var listener = google.maps.event.addListener(map, "idle", function() { 
                                if (map.getZoom() > 14) map.setZoom(14);
                                google.maps.event.removeListener(listener);
                            });
                        }

                        google.maps.event.addDomListener(window, 'load', initialize);
                    })();
                </script></div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#tncms-region-asset_side_sticky');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">

<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://magicvalley.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=ef51e264-4268-11e4-bd64-ef43a5a93592&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != 'ef51e264-4268-11e4-bd64-ef43a5a93592') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links

                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }

                        });

                } else {

                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

Wapanucka under boil-water order

By Kristen Shanahan&nbsp|&nbsp
Posted: Sat 5:20 PM, Sep 20, 2014 &nbsp|&nbsp
Updated: Sun 4:31 PM, Sep 21, 2014

WAPANUCKA, OK -- Wapanucka city officials say the Oklahoma Department of Environmental Quality has found a positive sample of E. coli in the city's water supply.

Residents are being asked to bring their water to a rolling boil for at least one minute before consumption, but the city recommends buying bottled water.

The boil-water order will remain in effect until further notice.

Russells Point issues advance boil alert

  • September 20, 2014
  • Written by THE BELLEFONTAINE EXAMINER STAFF

A leaking water main valve will be removed and the main waterline repaired at the intersection of Wilgus Drive and west Main Street in Russells Point beginning Monday, Sept. 22, with work completed by the end of the day, weather permitting.

All residents on First and Second streets, Coon Drive and the 100 and 200 blocks of west Main Street will be subject to temporary water service interruption and a boil water order until further notice.

For more information, contact water superintendent Dale Albert at (567) 674-1222.

Boil order issued for Alma Center

By Lindsay Alowairdi&nbsp|&nbsp
Posted: Fri 3:39 PM, Sep 19, 2014 &nbsp|&nbsp
Updated: Fri 5:19 PM, Sep 19, 2014

ALMA CENTER, Wis.(WEAU)-- An important notice if you live in the Village of Alma Center.

The Deputy Clerk there says the water is unsafe to drink and you should boil it until further notice. She says the village was notified by the DNR about the boil order.

The Deputy Clerk also says that they will be giving away bottled water to the residents of Alma Center on Saturday between noon and 4pm at the fire station in Alma Center.

The village is still looking into why the water was found unsafe.

Boil water order in effect for some residents in Weed

Thursday
Sep 18, 2014 at 8:14 AM

A boil water order remains in effect for the Weed area from Boles Creek north, according to information released Thursday morning by the City of Weed in coordination with the Siskiyou County Emergency Operations Center.

The City of Weed in coordination with the Siskiyou County Emergency Operations Center distributed the following Boles Fire information Thursday morning:

• The Red Cross Shelter location is now at the Mt. Shasta Armory, 518 Everitt Memorial Hwy. The Yreka Shelter has closed;

• A boil water order remains in effect for the Weed area from Boles Creek north;

• The City of Weed is asking all residents and businesses to continue water conservation measures until further notice;

• The City of Weed is in the process of developing information for fire debris safe removal and redevelopment;

• Pacific Power is testing transformers and restoring power to affected areas as quickly as safely possible;

• Crisis counseling is available to all residents;

• The Weed Police Department has established a Hot Line to provide information and is available 24/7. It’s asked that you please be patient with call center volunteers;

• CAL FIRE Information Line is available 24/7 at 530-408-6167

• Siskiyou County Public Health will be offering no cost tetanus shots for residents that will be involved in debris management and removal. According to a press release, “It is important to be current on your tetanus booster prior to beginning this type work. It is suggested if it has been 5-10 years since last dose, that you receive a booster dose.” The clinic will be located at College of the Siskiyous in the old Life Science Building on Friday, Sept. 19, from 10 am to 2 pm.

Further information is posted on the Weed Police Department Facebook page and Community Bulletin Boards.

Newberry water main rupture forces boil order

Tuesday
Sep 16, 2014 at 1:33 PM

A section of Newberry including the elementary school has been without water since Tuesday morning after a contractor installing new pipe accidentally hit an old main.

A section of Newberry including the elementary school has been without water since Tuesday morning after a contractor installing new pipe accidentally hit an old main, forcing the city to turn off the flow and issue a notice that water should be boiled until testing is completed.
The break occurred along Southwest 15th Avenue on an old line that the city did not have records on. The repair is expected to be completed and water restored by Tuesday afternoon, said city Utilities Manager Blaine Suggs.
However, residents are cautioned to boil their water in case of any contaminants.
“The water main that broke was adjacent to the elementary school,” Suggs said. “We are issuing a precautionary boil water notice and expect to have the results back in two days.”
- Cindy Swirko

<meta content="SEQUOYAH COUNTY (KFSM) - A boil order is in effect for those who live in the Lee Creek Rural Water District.

<div class="entry-content">
<div class="alignright wp-post-thumbnail">
<a data-keyboard="true" data-toggle="modal" href="#thumbnail-modal">
<img alt="" class=" wp-post-image" height="225" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px" src="http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2013/08/boil-order.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300&h=225&crop=1" srcset="http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2013/08/boil-order.jpg 300w, http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2013/08/boil-order.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150&h=113&crop=1 150w" width="300"/> </a>

<h4 class="title">Boil Order Issued For Muldrow Area</h4>
</div>
<div class="modal-body">
<img alt="" class="attachment-gallery-cover size-gallery-cover wp-post-image" height="225" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px" src="http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2013/08/boil-order.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300" srcset="http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2013/08/boil-order.jpg 300w, http://localtvkfsm.files.wordpress.com/2013/08/boil-order.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150 150w" width="300"/> <div class="lightbox-caption"></div>
</div>
</div>
<p>SEQUOYAH COUNTY (KFSM) – A boil order is in effect for those who live in the Lee Creek Rural Water District.</p>
<p>According to Lori Ree, Manager of Lee Creek Rural Water Department, those who live in the area a quarter mile west of Short Baptist Church in Muldrow to the bridge should boil their water until further notice.</p>
</div>

		mobileStatsQueryString += "&x_" + 'mobile_platforms' + '=' + wpcom_mobile_user_agent_info.matchedPlatformName;
	
	if( false !== wpcom_mobile_user_agent_info.matchedUserAgentName )
		mobileStatsQueryString += "&x_" + 'mobile_devices' + '=' + wpcom_mobile_user_agent_info.matchedUserAgentName;
	
	if( wpcom_mobile_user_agent_info.isIPad() )
		mobileStatsQueryString += "&x_" + 'ipad_views' + '=' + 'views';

	if( "" != mobileStatsQueryString ) {
		new Image().src = document.location.protocol + '//pixel.wp.com/g.gif?v=wpcom-no-pv' + mobileStatsQueryString + '&baba=' + Math.random();
	}
	
}
</script></body>
</html>

Celebrating clean water

Monday
Sep 15, 2014 at 12:01 AM Sep 15, 2014 at 6:11 AM

Pocono residents enjoy the great privilege of turning on the tap and pouring a glass of clean water. People so take this for granted that they are stumped by the occasional boil-water order. Likewise, anglers have come to expect that the streams in the Poconos will remain hospitable to the trout they love to pursue, swiftly flowing streams shaded by lacy hemlocks and protected from harmful runoff or discharges.

Pocono residents enjoy the great privilege of turning on the tap and pouring a glass of clean water. People so take this for granted that they are stumped by the occasional boil-water order. Likewise, anglers have come to expect that the streams in the Poconos will remain hospitable to the trout they love to pursue, swiftly flowing streams shaded by lacy hemlocks and protected from harmful runoff or discharges.

But it's never safe to assume. Members of the Brodhead Watershed Association know that very well. For a quarter of a century, they have watched over Brodhead Creek from its headwaters in Barrett Township to its confluence with the Delaware River. BWA's efforts have helped shepherd the Pocono Mountains through periods of rapid growth without significant adverse effects on its major streams. On Thursday, Oct, 2, BWA members and friends will celebrate their first 25 years with a gala banquet and program at the Chateau in Tannersville.

Clean water is an essential part of a healthy community. Monroe County is lucky that in the late 1980s, a group of committed citizens, including environmental stewards, business owners and developers, joined forces with an eye toward sustainable economic growth. They kept track of the health of the Brodhead with teams of trained, volunteer stream watchers who would visit designated sites along the creek monthly. Still today, volunteers measure the water's acidity and temperature. They also assess clarity or turbidity, and check conditions on the streambank. Yearly, they conduct fecal coliform tests. A lab examines samples for the presence of human or animal waste, in which case BWA members would try to determine whether the pollution came from a random animal visit or a malfunctioning septic system or treatment plant.

Twelve visits per site per year. Numerous sites. For 25 years, along the Brodhead and the McMichael, which was added later. That is a measure of the commitment of BWA to a region that has been under almost constant pressure of residential and commercial development. Many more people live here, and many more businesses have opened their doors since BWA began. Yet trout still swim in our streams, and the Pocono area's clean waters remain a draw for residents and tourists alike. That is a testament to the BWA's dedication.

Join the BWA on Oct. 2. Celebrate its anniversary and honor its success in maintaining water that enhances everyone's quality of life.
